message.content:
cs.SD, cs.MA, cs.NI, cs.HC, cs.CY

The paper focuses on the design and implementation of a noise mapping system using smart phones, which involves aspects of signal processing, machine learning, and human-computer interaction. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.SD (Sound), which specifically deals with audio and acoustic signal processing. 

The paper also discusses the use of interpolation and regularization methods to recover the noise map from incomplete and random samples, which falls under the category of cs.MA (Machine Learning). 

The context-aware sensing and classification of phone sensing context involve aspects of cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) and cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction). 

Finally, the paper discusses the potential applications of the noise mapping system in urban planning and environmental monitoring, which falls under the category of cs.CY (Computers and Society).
